reviews.text: Stayed for one night for meeting purpose. Nice experience, rooms are rather big for Paris norms. Fluent checkin, though disappointing that taxi driver had no idea what the W Paris hotel is, did not know adress and thought I was going to an office building ...
reviews.title: 1 night stay, nice experience

reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel

reviews.text: I travel w/Starwood hotels because of the level of service that I will receive no matter what country I am traveling too.

reviews.title: Fantastic A+++

reviews.title: Romantic Paris in the W

reviews.title: Amazing hotel, best from our trip across Europe

reviews.title: Great location for shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on our honeymoon and this was our "splurge" to end our visit in Paris. We arrived around 5pm and our room wasn't ready. Cecil, the W Insider, was so kind and friendly. She apologized and gave us a tour of the hotel and gave us each a glass of Champagne. After an hour of relaxing at the bar, we asked if we could use the gym - no problem. Cecil even brough our room keys to the gym! Our bags that we left at check in magically appeared in our room. We loved the Magnificent Suite (Room 414) - King bed, sofa, huge closet, soaking tub, rain shower (watch out - it's slippery!), dual sink, and many windows with views of the Opera house. We felt pampered the entire visit. Turn down service in the evening included a treat, window blinds closed, etc. Breakfast in bed was nice and the bartenders were super nice (Thank you Chloe!). Highly recommend the espresso's at the W too. They come with vanilla simple syrup - yum! Transportation to CDG was also very easy using the Roissy Bus - note: the bus drivers take bills and US credit cards - just not the automated machines at the bus stop). Thank you to all who made this a great stay at the W Paris Opera!
reviews.title: 5 Star Service for this 5 Star Hotel

reviews.text: This is my second stay at this hotel. The staff are just wonderful. They make this place great. The rooms are very nice and the bed is exquisite but its the staff that make me come back. You are always greeted with a smile. They gave me an upgraded room and free internet which was very welcome. I had an entire afternoon of meetings in the bar and wished there were more places on the ground floor (living room) where the music wasn't so loud. But thats the same at all these properties. I did notice that the wall in the entry foyer in my room was pretty banged up with nicks and marks. The matte black paint shows a lot of wear and tear to an otherwise clean and tidy room. Everything is expensive so I do my best to avoid the mini bar and breakfast. But, even so, Ill be back.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Staying in Paris comes with a certain expectation of cramped, older rooms and poor service. W Opera was nothing like this. The service was outstanding and everything about the hotel felt fresh and new without taking away from the charm and character of the area. The staff made us feel like VIP's and addressed our every need. The location was very convnient to shopping, many restaurants, and the Metro. We will stay again.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: All the 5 star reviews are true! Our room was bright, modern, stylish but comfortable, kept spotless with 3 touch-ups a day; staff are wonderfully attentive without being intrusive, highly professional; location in the heart of Paris - steps from transport hubs and the flagship department stores - can't be beat! We didn't really fit their typical guest demographic (middle-aged mom and teen son) but were nonetheless welcomed like VIPs and made to feel perfectly at-home for a week's stay.
reviews.title: immaculate, impeccable

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is outstanding. The location is close to shopping, restaurants, metro. The lounge at the hotel is excellent for unwinding and pre-dinner drinks. The staff are very friendly and quiet professional. The concierge is amazing with handling your requests, Resturant bookings, and suggesting suitable alternatives. An overall amazing experience.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: We stayed at the W in August. The staff found a French teacher for me at short notice in spite of the fact that everything was closed! The service was great, location is fantastic, rooms are great. The only fault was the breakfast which was expensive (45 Euros) and very ordinary. BHaving stayed at the W in Hong Kong (amazing breakfasts) we were very disappointed. Otherwise great experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff! Great w experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have high expectations when I stay @ W Hotels - so "great" is always expected. This hotel was amazing and exceeded my expectations. The staff go above and beyond to make your stay just what you want it to be. That is precisely what sets this hotel apart. The concierge team operates like a personal travel team. They plan, guide and advise on anything that you need. The service is especially helpful if you don't know Paris well and if you don't speak French.
reviews.title: Fab hotel: staff is 2nd to none!

reviews.text: The location is A+, the airport bus service is across the street behind the Opera house.
reviews.title: Great staff

reviews.text: Location is also good: we walked to many destinations and used the metro which stops close by.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible location. Staff was more than accommodating. They made our stay truly special. We would certainly stay there again and again and again. The location can't be beat. It is a two minute walk from the subway no need for cabs :)
reviews.title: Rooms are so small :((
